about.title: About Me
about.description: I am a final-year undergraduate in Electrical and Computer Engineering at Sichuan University Pittsburgh Institute (SCUPI), graduating in 2026 with a GPA of 3.95/4.00 (top of my cohort). My research lies at the intersection of photonics and artificial intelligence, where I develop physics-informed models, photonic devices, and machine learning methods for sensing, wireless propagation, and intelligent system design.
about.description2: I have authored or co-authored 8 journal papers and 2 conference papers. My long-term goal is to pursue a PhD in Photonics + AI to address challenges in sensing, communication, and computational hardware.

publications.title: Publications
publications.subtitle: My research contributions and academic publications

paper1.title: Generalizable Physics-Informed Long-Range Attentive Network for Radio Wave Propagation Modeling in Tunnels
paper1.authors: Wu, K., Ni, K., Xu, H., Wang, J., Qin, H., Zhang, X., & Zhang, X.
paper1.journal: IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques
paper1.abstract: We propose a physics-informed long-range attentive propagation network (PLAPN) with a sliding window strategy to accurately and efficiently predict long-range radio wave propagation in tunnels from short-range simulation data.

paper2.title: Intelligent Optimization of Wireless Access Point Deployment for Communication-Based Train Control Systems Using Deep Reinforcement Learning
paper2.authors: Wu, K., Zhao, Q, Feng, Z., Qin, H., Zhang, X., & Zhang, X.
paper2.journal: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
paper2.abstract: We develop a Deep Reinforce Learning (DRL)-driven framework combining physics-based PWE simulation, conditional Generative Adversarial Network (cGAN)-based data augmentation, and Dueling Deep Q-Network (DQN) optimization to achieve accurate, efficient, and robust access point placement for CBTC tunnel systems.

paper3.title: Tunable Perfect Absorber Using Symmetrical π-Shaped Infrared Metamaterial for Sensing Application
paper3.authors: Wu, K., Zheng, D., Zhu, Y., Ye, Z., & Lin, Y.-S.
paper3.abstract: We designed a MEMS-tunable π-shaped perfect absorber in the mid-infrared (MIR) range that enables dynamic dual-resonance control, polarization switching, and high-sensitivity refractive index sensing for advanced photonic applications.

paper4.title: ATTRN: Acoustic Information Encoder and Temperature Field Reconstruction Decoder Network for Boiler Temperature Field Reconstruction
paper4.authors: Wu, K., Ni, K., Chen, L., Xu, H., Wang, J., Zhou, J., & Zhou, X.
paper4.abstract: We developed an (Transformer-CNN-based) ATTRN machine learning model that directly predicts boiler furnace temperature fields from acoustic measurements (Time of flight), improving accuracy, generalization, and industrial applicability over traditional methods.

paper5.title: Enhancing Character-Coherent Role-Playing Dialogue with a Verifiable Emotion Reward
paper5.abstract: This paper introduces a Verifiable Emotion Reward (VER) to reduce emotional drift in role-playing with LLMs. We also construct CHARCO, a 230k multi-turn dataset with persona and emotion labels, and design a retrieval-augmented memory module. Experiments show improved emotional consistency, role fidelity, and dialogue coherence.

paper6.title: KI-Shaped Terahertz Metamaterial with Tunable Filtering, Attenuating, and Sensing Characteristics
paper6.authors: Ye, Z., Zheng, D., Zhu, Y., Wu, K., & Lin, Y.-S.
paper6.abstract: Analyzed KI-shaped terahertz resonators, guiding parameter optimization to achieve tunable filtering, signal suppression, and refractive index sensing performance.

paper7.title: Trajectory-Regularized Localization in Asynchronous Acoustic Networks via Enhanced PSO Optimization
paper7.authors: Zhou, J., Zhao, Q, Feng, Z, Wu, K., Zhang, L., & Qin, H.
paper7.abstract: We propose a trajectory-based localization framework using ToA and FoA with an enhanced PSO solver. The method improves accuracy and robustness in asynchronous acoustic networks, keeping over 90% of errors within 3 m.

conf1.title: Vector Parabolic Equation-Driven Temporal Attention Model for Propagation Modeling in Tunnels
conf1.authors: Xu, H., Wang, J., Wu, K., Zhao, Q, Qin, H., Zhang, X., & Zhang, X.
conf1.abstract: Presented a temporal attention model for EM wave propagation in tunnels, driven by the vector parabolic equation. Manuscript accepted.

conf2.title: Conceptor-Augmented Regularization for RNN and LSTM Networks
conf2.authors: Zhao, D., Zhang, Z., Kang, Y., Wu, K., Ouyang, Y., Qian, G., & Ouyang, Y., Qian, G.
conf2.conference: IEEE 2nd International Conference on Deep Learning and Computer Vision
conf2.abstract: Introduced conceptor-augmented regularization to improve the generalization of RNN and LSTM networks.

arxiv1.title: Enhancing Code LLMs with Reinforcement Learning in Code Generation: A Survey
arxiv1.authors: Wang, J., Zhang, Z., He, Y., Song, Y., Shi, T., Li, Y., Xu, H., Wu, K., Qian, G., Chen, Q., & He, L.
arxiv1.description: Survey on improving code generation in large language models (LLMs) using reinforcement learning techniques. arXiv preprint arXiv:2412.20367.
